description: This module gathers facts for a specific system using its HP iLO interface. These facts include hardware and network related information useful for provisioning (e.g. macaddress, uuid).
This module requires the hpilo python module.
author: Dag Wieers
notes: This module ought to be run from a system that can access the HP iLO interface directly, either by using C(local_action) or C(using delegate)_to.

examples.code:
local_action: hpilo_facts host=$ilo_address login=$ilo_login password=$ilo_password match=$inventory_hostname_short
only_if: "'$cmdb_hwmodel'.startswith('HP ')
examples.description: Task to gather facts from a HP iLO interface only if the system is an HP server

examples.code:
- hw_bios_date: "05/05/2011"
  hw_bios_version: "P68"
  hw_eth0:
  - macaddress: "00:11:22:33:44:55"
    macaddress_dash: "00-11-22-33-44-55"
  hw_eth1:
  - macaddress: "00:11:22:33:44:57"
    macaddress_dash: "00-11-22-33-44-57"
  hw_eth2:
  - macaddress: "00:11:22:33:44:5A"
    macaddress_dash: "00-11-22-33-44-5A"
  hw_eth3:
  - macaddress: "00:11:22:33:44:5C"
    macaddress_dash: "00-11-22-33-44-5C"
  hw_eth_ilo:
  - macaddress: "00:11:22:33:44:BA"
    macaddress_dash: "00-11-22-33-44-BA"
  hw_product_name: "ProLiant DL360 G7"
  hw_product_uuid: "ef50bac8-2845-40ff-81d9-675315501dac"
  hw_system_serial: "ABC12345D6"
  hw_uuid: "123456ABC78901D2"
examples.description: Typical output of HP iLO_facts for a physical system

short_description: Gather facts through an HP iLO interface

description: The HP iLO hostname/address that is linked to the physical system.
The password to authenticate to the HP iLO interface.
The login name to authenticate to the HP iLO interface.
An optional string to match against the iLO server name.
This is a safety measure to prevent accidentally using the wrong HP iLO interface with dire consequences.
